update.description:
This adds <collide_bitmask> support to bullet.

There was some code that looked like an attempt to add support that was never completed. This pull request keeps a limitation from this old code: BulletLink adds all collisions on a Link to the same btRigidBody and uses the bitmask of the first collision. I cannot find a way to remove this limitation without breaking ABI.

Future work could remove this limitation by having BulletLink create a btRigidBody for every collision and join them together with fixed constraints. Then every collision could have it's own mask.
update.title: [gazebo7] Added <collide_bitmask> support to bullet

content.raw:
I made the test independent of the bounciness of the physics engine and started a new build
http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any/466/

I would have liked to make the world use the <bounce> parameters in SDF, but bullet doesn't support them :(

content.raw: I think the test is probably failing because the geometry bounces when using bullet, but not when using ode. However, I would have expected the bounce to cause the test to fail in xenial too

content.raw:
Homebrew job had a test failure: INTEGRATION_surface_properties, I'm investigating

On the xenial builds all tests pass except for cppcheck which fails with 205 errors. None of them appear to be caused by this pull request.

Windows 7 build failed to find ignition-math3
